title: If no webapps deployed, accessing a URL returns 200 OK with no content instead of 404
description:
When I start a Tomcat 7 instance without any webapps deployed and access a URL, it currently returns HTTP code 200 OK with no content, instead of the expected HTTP error 404.

According to the bug report, the user downloaded the Tomcat 7.0.0 beta from http://mirror.veriportal.com/apache/tomcat/tomcat7/v7.0.0beta/bin/apachetomcat7.0.0.zip and encountered this issue.
OB: When accessing a URL on a Tomcat 7 instance with no webapps deployed, it returns HTTP code 200 OK with no content.
EB: I expected to see an HTTP error 404 when accessing a URL on a Tomcat 7 instance with no webapps deployed.
SR:
To reproduce the issue:
1. Download the Tomcat 7.0.0 beta from http://mirror.veriportal.com/apache/tomcat/tomcat7/v7.0.0beta/bin/apachetomcat7.0.0.zip
2. Start a Tomcat 7 instance without deploying any webapps.
3. Access a URL on the Tomcat instance.

Expected result: An HTTP error 404 should be returned.
Actual result: HTTP code 200 OK is returned with no content.
